videos.title: Twisted Fishtail | Holiday Hairstyle | Prom Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:

videos.title: Triple Bun Updo | Homecoming Hairstyles | Easy DIY Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
If you have ever visited Texas in the summer you know how important cute, easy DIY undo hairstyles can become!  It's so hot and getting your hair off your neck with a DIY undo is the perfect hairstyle to pair with a fun dress or even a work outfit.  
This hairstyle is even more awesome because it can so easily translate into a homecoming hairstyle, a prom hairstyle, or even a hairstyle for any other special event.  This simple beginner hairstyle is made up of three simple braids which means that anyone can do it!  Even if your looking for a DIY hairstyle!  
After creating three ponytails, you add braids to each one to create braided buns.  Twist the buns up and bobby pin in place and voila you have a great easy DIY undo!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHTripleBunUpdo

videos.description:
PREORDER BrooklynAndBailey's Single "WHAT WE'RE MADE OF" ‚ñ∂ http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/WWMO

This week's hairstyle tutorial is perfect for summer, and it is a super cute way of changing up your typical tieback. The inspiration is a butterfly, for those who love butterflies, and a version of which was something I had see by a fellow IG hair braider, HairDesignsByK.

Rylan volunteered to by my hair model today, and I added in the ribbon just for her... but for myself or for the twins, I would leave the hair as is. 

You have seen this topsy tail technique before, from our Valentine's Day heart hairstyles. If you are good with your fingers with braiding, you can easily pull the hair through on your own. Using a mirror, this can also be an easy DIY hairstyle.

videos.title: Lace Pull Thru Braid | Rosette Bun | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I seriously can't get enough of Pull Thru Braids!  They are such simple hairstyles to do and certainly easy hairstyles for even a beginner to pull off.  You don't even need to know how to braid since the Pull Thru braid is really a faux braid!  

In this easy DIY hairstyle tutorial I took the pull thru braid to a new level by adding hair ONLY from one side to create a lace braid effect. 
I then used a regular three strand braid to create a nice rosette bun at the end of the simple Pull Thru braid.  In the end I have a gorgeous hairstyle that looks amazing! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHLacePullThru

videos.title: How to Create a Dutch Lace Braid Combo | Long Hairstyles
videos.description:
You must be looking for a beautiful braid hairstyle this summer for girls with long hair! This Dutch Lace Braid Combo is the perfect style for you! Learn how to create these easy braids in just a few minutes by clicking above!

Inspiration for this hairstyle came from the show "Vikings" on the History Channel and my friend JennisHairDays on Instagram. To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDutchLaceCombo

This hairstyle uses a combination of a French Braid, Lace Braids (where you only pick up hair from the top), and simple 3-strand braids. You can add curls or waves to hair as a base, but I find that the braids pop more without the added texture. Just straight hair is fine.

As part of the step by step instructions, I added a quick back comb to the top section before French Braiding, to add volume to the braid, but you do not have to do so. On the Lace Braids, I wanted them to only add in hair from the top. (Although they look like Dutch Braids/Cornrows, they are in fact Lace Braids.) 

This cute hair style will work on long hair and medium hair. It is perfect for girls of all ages as well, and holds up well during a long day of activity.

I think this hairstyle is a beauty, all the while looking tough, too! I've seen variations of this hairstyle on Lagertha on the show Vikings, although she's added more rows of Lace Braids on the sides.

Please be sure to click the "üîî" next to the SUBSCRIBE button, to join our Notification Squad for #PowerHour each week, and leave a comment below telling me what you would like to see next!

üíã's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 3 hair elastics, hairspray or dry wax {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 8-10 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.title: How to Create a Rosette Tieback in Under 5 Minutes?
videos.description:
DOWNLOAD SIMPLE THINGS (iTunes) ‚ñ∂ http://smarturl.it/BBSimpleThings

DOWNLOAD SIMPLE THINGS (Google Play) ‚ñ∂ http://play.google.com/store/music/album/Brooklyn_and_Bailey_Simple_Things?id=Bysb7jjszngjqm7gp3g2z2rfwbm&hl=en

Beautiful festival hair is all in season right now, with Coachella now finished and summer about to start! All of the many different boho an Bohemian hairstyles are out in full force, so we decided to show you today how to create this beautiful Rosette Tieback hairstyle! What can look more like a Coachella hairstyle, than to make it look like you have flowers in your hair!

And DON'T FORGET to enter BrooklynAndBailey's 13" MacBook Air GIVEAWAY here ‚ñ∂ http://cutegirlshairstyles.com/SimpleThingsGive

KamriNoel volunteered to be my model today, and I had her add in base curls to her hair with a wand, just to add a bit of texture and to give that needed relaxed look to the hair. If you know how to create a simple braid, this hairstyle is one that you will be able to do! Pullbacks, or tiebacks, are super easy. Pancaking a braid is also easy. The key really is in rolling up the pancaked braid into a rosette and getting it pinned securely.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHRosetteTieback

Once you have the rosette secured properly, feel free to add hairspray or spray wax to help hold in the flyaways. You may also choose to add tiny flowers, or flower accessories to complete the look. It is totally up to you!

This hairstyle is perfect for long hair or medium hair, so feel free to add this to your bank of hairstyles for long hair!

Don't forget to download BrooklynAndBailey's NEW single "Simple Things" from the link at the top of the description box, and also the laptop GIVEAWAY further down! Comment down below if you have entered!

üíã's -Mindy

Time Requirement: 5 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.title: 3 Prom Hairstyles | Updo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
It's springtime and nearly Prom season which means girls all around the world are watching prom vlogs, prom makeup tutorials, and prom grwm videos frantically trying to decide which prom hairstyles, prom dress, and prom makeup to wear!   Have you finished your prom get ready with me plans? Or finished your last minute prom dress shopping? Or if your early in the prom season for your school have you decided on your promposal?  

Have no fear because this video is about to show you 3 Prom Hairstyles that are all adorable, would look great with any prom dress, and are still an easy DIY.   You won't even need mom to schedule a hairdresser appointment or beg your best friend to do it! 
The first style is two basic fishtails that are knotted together and then bobby pinned in place.  Add some gorgeous curls and you are set to go.  

The second prom hairstyle is created by taking two dutch braids from either side of the head and wrapping them around a low braided bun.  This prom hairstyle will keep your shoulders cooler and keep you from sweating too much as your dancing the night away. 

The third style is a faux braid.  That's right!  A faux braid!  You don't even need to know how to do a simple three strand braid as this just uses two strands and a series of elastics to create this gorgeous side braid.  Pair this hairstyle with a less fancy dress to add some pop and get everyone talking about your hair! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGH3PromStyles

videos.title: Side Pull Thru Braid Combo | Prom Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
This #CGHSidePullThruCombo is such a fun hairstyle and great for many uses.  You can wear this easy DIY hairstyle as an everyday hairstyle to work or to school.  Or you can wear this DIY hairstyle for something fancy like prom!  

I love side fishtail braids and I especially love pull thru braids.  This great hairstyle combines the two and adds a twist to make it a fancy updo or a casual relaxed look!

To begin create a side fishtail on one side of the head.  Secure this with bobby pins.  Now add a twist from each side and secure directly under the fishtail braid.  

Use the remaining hair to create two sections and begin a pull thru braid using elastics.  Pancake the hair to add extra volume and beauty.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHSidePullThruCombo

videos.title: Stacked Fishtail Updo | Prom Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Undo hairstyles can be used for so many occasions whether it be work, a party, a wedding, prom, homecoming, or even just a nice date night out.  This undo is no exception but I can imagine it being used as a beautiful prom hairstyle!  It would work especially well as a prom hairstyle for long hair or a prom hairstyle for medium hair.  It wouldn't work well for a prom hairstyle for short hair.   

What do you like to wear for your prom hair?  Do you look on Youtube for ideas for your prom hair and makeup?  If so, I hope this Stacked Fishtail Undo will help you! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHStackedFishtailUpdo

Begin this undo hairstyle by taking a medium section off your top part and separating it into two smaller sections.  Make sure to leave a little hair near the front of your head for later.  

Begin a dutch fishtail braid adding in new hair near the top and then only using that hair near the bottom.  Secure with an elastic.

Now go back and pick up the hair near the front of your face.  Divide it into three sections and create a dutch braid near your face and then continue a regular braid at the bottom.  Secure with an elastic.  

Pull all the loose hair from the other side of your head back and gather all hair except the small dutch braid into a ponytail near the nape of your neck.  Pancake the fishtail as needed.  

Take the dutch braid and run it along the top of the fishtail braid and use bobby pins to attach it and create a stacked look. Secure the dutch braid to the hair with a clear elastic.  Only pull the hair through halfway the second time.  Take a section from the top of the loop and use a bobby pin to secure it and create a nice bun shape.  Repeat on the bottom until you have a perfect bun.  

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us...

videos.title: Double Dutch Half Up | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
This lovely double dutch hairstyle is the perfect combination of dutch braids with a half up  and hair buns to create an easy DIY hairstyle!  This hairstyle is a perfect for a prom hairstyle, a date night hairstyle, a bohemian hairstyle for Coachella, or even just a fun back to school hairstyle!  I would love to see some of you use this style for prom hair!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDoubleDutchHalfUp

Begin by parting hair slightly off to one side. On the heavy side of the hair part hair from the eyebrow back to the end of the part on the top of your head.  This should form a rectangle shape.  

Move the rest of the hair out of the way.  With the piece you left out, make a diagonal part line to create two separate sections of hair.  

With the back section of hair begin a dutch braid.  When finished secure with an elastic.  Repeat this process with the front section.  

Now take a piece of hair from the opposite side of the head and pull it back.  Combine this piece with the two dutch braids and secure them together with an elastic.  Remove any other elastics.  On the last loop of the elastic joining all the hair together only pull the hair halfway through.  Now use bobby pins to create a nice bun shape with the remaining hair.  Twist any ends around and into place and shape with bobby pins.  

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us...

videos.title: Half Up Heart Bun | Valentine's Day Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
More Valentine's hairstyles!  Who's excited??  I know I just love heart hairstyles.  I especially love when I find good heart hairstyles for kids and also heart hair that will work on teens/adults too! I think that this Valentine hair would be perfect for any romantic holiday...anniversary, wedding, fun Friday night date, etc..  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHHalfUpHeartBun

To begin this Valentine's day hairstyle start by pulling some of the top hair back into a ponytail near the crown.  Remember to keep the style soft and loose.  Take one of the remaining side pieces and begin to braid it.  Secure with an elastic and repeat on the other side.  Take both braids and secure them together directly under the ponytail.  This will help keep the elastic hidden.

On the original ponytail we are going to create a heart hair flip.  Create a small hole in the ponytail and flip the hair under and through the hole.  Secure that out of the way temporarily.  

Now take two more side pieces and twist them back toward the back of the hair.  Loosen them a little to keep them soft.  Take them up and over the braids and bobby pin them.  

Lower the flip hair back down and divide it into two pieces.  Spray it a little with hairspray or wax to add a little stiffness.  You can also tease the pieces a little to add texture.  Begin to use these pieces to form the shape of a half heart.  Clip the loops down to help keep the separated as you secure them together at the point of the heart. 

Readjust any bobby pins that may be showing through and hair wrap the last elastic.

videos.title: Sweetheart Braid Combo | Heart Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Who doesn't love wearing stylish Heart Hairstyles to match this season of love?  I know wearing heart hairstyles at this time of year is often a favorite thing to do!  And I'd imagine you will always get so many compliments from teachers, friends, or even random strangers with this lovely hair!  

To create this Sweetheart Braid Combo begin by creating a part from one side of the head to the back middle.  Then create half of a heart shape on either side. Pull the heart shape hair into an elastic to keep it out of the way.  Secure the hair on the right side out of the way too. 

Begin to braid the left side of the hair.  We used a lace dutch braid so we only added pieces into one side of the braid.  Braid this all the way down to the ear and continue a regular braid till the end of the hair.  Repeat on the other side.

Then use a french braid to braid the heart shape hair together.  At the end braid all the hair together to create one single braid and secure the ends with an elastic.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHSweetheartCombo

videos.title: Double French Buns | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
This hair tutorial has to be a new favorite!  I LOVE the way these simple french braids combine with buns to create an easy, but flawless look.  Pair this DIY hairstyle sweater and prepare for compliments!  

Begin by parting your hair into two even sections.  Secure one section out of the way. Add dry shampoo for more volume.  Begin creating a french braid on one side of the head.  You can pause about half way down the braid to pancake and create more volume and fullness. 

At the nape of the neck take any remaining hair and secure into a ponytail.   Repeat this process on the other side until you have two secured ponytails at the nape of neck. 

 Now create buns at the bottom of they hairstyle.  You do this by only pulling the hair half way thru the last wrap of the elastic.  Then bobby pin the top half up into a crescent shape.  Roll the bottom hair up and again pin into place to create a full bun shape.  Repeat on the other side.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDoubleFrenchBuns

videos.title: Dutch Pull Thru Combo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I love this hair tutorial for medium to long hair because it's great for different textures of hair AND it's great for athletic girls who need a gym hairstyle or a sports hairstyle.  

To begin, seperate off a V shaped top section of hair and secure the rest out of the way.  Add a dutch braid to the top section (you can pancake it if you want).  Add an elastic after you hit the bottom of the V to secure.  

Now take two sections on the sides of the V and smooth them.  Pull them together with the dutch braid and secure them all together.  You can remove the second rubber band if the braid is too long.  

Now begin to form a second ponytail below this first section of hair.  You will use these two pieces to form a pull thru braid.  Continue the pull thru braid all the way down the hair and then pancake it to make it extra full.  Secure the two ends together into one elastic at the bottom.  

With the tight braiding at the top and all the elastics down the pull thru braid, this briad is sure to stay in place and hold for a long time!  You will love this for gymnastics, dance, or other sports/athletics!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDutchPullThruCombo

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us...

videos.title: Wrapped Pull Thru Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
One of my all time favorite hairstyles is the Pull Thru Braid.  So when I learned this version I knew I had to show others too!  This hairstyle tutorial is perfect for any occasion including a Homecoming dance hairstyle, a prom hairstyle, a simple every day hairstyle, or even an athletic hairstyle.

Begin this hairstyle by creating a french braid on each side of the head.  I don't add in much hair and when I run out of hair at the end I simply secure with an elastic.  

Now I take a small section of hair near the back of my head and add an elastic.  I like to poof this section to add some volume and fulness to my hairstyle.  This also gives me the base of the pull-thru braid.  

Create an entire pull thru braid with the remainer of the hair.  Be sure to pancake the hair as you go to add even more fullness!  Now I take the beginning french braids and lay them over the top of the pull thru. Use bobby pins to secure the braids to the back of your head.  

Once they are secure I roll the braid up and into a ball and tuck it under the braids to hide the ends.  Again use bobby pins to secure.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHWrappedPullThru

videos.title: Dutch Braided Bun | Updo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Looking for a great holiday party hair idea?  This cute updo is perfect for younger girls, teens, and even adults. You can be worn to a holiday party, or even as a prom hairstyle or a homecoming hairstyle. You are sure to be a hit at any of your events this year with this Dutch Braided Bun! 

Begin by parting hair stightly off to one side of your head.   Dutch braid this section keeping the dutch braid close to the ear.   

With the other section of hair begin another dutch braid and keep it rounded close to the ear again, but this time it needs to swing at the end toward the middle of the head.  Be sure to pancake both Dutch braids to add volume and fullness!  

Begin taking sections of hair from the ponytail on the left and wind them up over your fingers.  Hold them close to the scalp and bobby pin them into place.  

Once all the hair is bobby pinned into place to create a great updo bun then take the first braid ends and twist the braid into the bun to add lots of fun patterns throughout the bun!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBraidedBunUpdo

videos.title: HAIR HACK: DIY Reverse Braid in Under 2 Minutes! | Life Hacks | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Looking for the quickest way to get a cute braid hairstyle in under two minutes? Then this braid hair hack is for you! This has to be one of the coolest hair tutorials I have ever seen! Whoever came up with this hair style was GENIUS!

I tried this braid on myself, after seeing a video of it floating around on Facebook several months ago (one made by BraidsInAction). Kamri and I just had to film our interpretation of how to create this beautiful look! In fact, we are adding it to our list of best life hacks!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHReverseBraidHack

You create what looks like a dutch braid beneath your chin with the hair that you have hanging down. Then after securing it, you flip it over the head... leaving you with what looks very much like a mermaid braid!

This will work with medium long, to long hairstyles, but unfortunately will not work on short hair. This is a perfect hairstyle for those mornings when you are running late, but still want a gorgeous hairstyle!

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us if you are already following KamriNoel's channel!

videos.description:

Of course during the holiday parties you want to look your best so today I am showing you how to do this amazing Side Swept Fishtail Updo holiday hairstyle.

This holiday hair is great as a holiday hairstyle for medium hair, and a holiday hairstyle for long hair!

videos.title: Holiday Twisted Updo | Holiday Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Halloween is over and the Thanksgiving holiday and Christmas holiday are just around the corner.  With the holidays come parties!  Which means you need to look amazing in your holiday hairstyle and holiday clothes!  
Today I'm showing you a simple and basic holiday hairstyle tutorial that you can do in no time flat.  This style would look great as a holiday hairstyle for medium hair or a holiday hairstyle for long hair.  If you pair this holiday hair with some holiday makeup you are sure to get many compliments!

To begin section off two areas of hair near each ear.  Secure the rest of the hair at the nape of the neck into a messy bun.  On the light side of the head create a rope twist.  Twist it back against the head and over the top of the bun and bobby pin into place.  
On the heavy hair side of the head take half of the hair and first create a braid.  Secure the braid with an elastic and bobby pin into place over the bun and twist from before.  

With the remaining hair create another rope twist.  Hold onto a small piece at the bottom of the twist and push upward to pancake the twist into nice pretty waves.  Secure this with bobby pins just beneath the braid.  

You now have great holiday hair!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHHolidayTwistedUpdo

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us...

videos.title: Side Elastic Braid | DIY Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Whether you're looking for a homecoming hairstyle or an everyday look, this side elastic braid is one of my absolute favorite hairstyles! This DIY hairstyle may look complicated, but in reality it is super simple and quick to do! You will love this look for a prom hairstyle, a holiday party hairstyle, or even a romantic beach hairstyle look  

To recreate this DIY hairstyle tutorial you begin by creating a lace braid on the side of the head near the temple.  Only adding hair into the one side of the braid.  Then I go back and pancake the hair to add fullness and fluff.  

Once the lace braid is secure then I take the lace braid and another small piece of hair from the other side.  Secure them together.  

From this point on you just need to take one piece of hair from each side, twist the hair, and then secure them with an elastic.  Go back and tug on the hair to loosen the twists and make it look so pretty and full.  

The ease comes from you only needing to use a few elastics and twists.  But the braid itself looks so amazing and beautiful.  It looks like a fancy french braid or a fax french braid.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHElasticBraid

videos.title: Harley Quinn Pigtails | DIY Halloween Costumes | DIY Halloween Hairstyles
videos.description:
This Halloween, you're likely to see lots of Harley Quinn DIY Halloween Costumes from the movie Suicide Squad. Getting the hairstyle look is super easy to do, and we will show you how!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHHarleyQuinn

Harley Quinn, played by Margo Robbie, is The Joker's girlfriend in the movie with a very unique beauty... and she's one tough cookie! (No doubt Batman will have his hands full whenever she's around!) Since this is Halloween season, we get to post new DIY halloween costumes and we could not resist this one! We pieced together Brooklyn's costume from Amazon, and spent a few minutes creating our own Harley Quinn DIY Halloween makeup look.

To get the Harley Quinn DIY Halloween hairstyle, we added soft curls as a base, then parted Brooklyn's hair straight down the middle. We then gathered the two sides up in to high pigtails. Next, we added temporary pink colored hairspray to the bottom edges of Brooklyn's right side, then blue-colored hairspray the the left. We then took one small strand on each side to create a colored hair wrap and secured them with small bobby pins.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us which of all our #CGHSpooktorials over the years is your favorite so far!

videos.title: Mermaid Crown Braid | Halloween Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
With Halloween just around the corner, this Mermaid inspired crown braid will surely impress! This pretty style is perfect for a Mermaid Halloween costume or as beachy waves!  It's definitely an  everyday hairstyle as it only takes minutes, but can also be easily adapted to fit for a prom hairstyle, a homecoming hairstyle or even your own personal Halloween costume!

In this hairstyle tutorial, I show you how to take two simple lace braids and mix them with regular braids to create a lovely crown braid.  This effect give such a pretty finished look!  Especially if you also pancake the braids to make them nice and full.  

But this same Halloween hairstyle can transition into a beautiful and fun Halloween hairstyle for teens, girls, or women by simply adding some sea shells glued to bobby pins.  The shells create a darling DIY Halloween craft and will leaven you looking exactly like a Mermaid caught on tape in real life!  All you would need to add a sea shell swim top, Mermaid tail, and a little glittery Mermaid makeup!  

I certainly love Halloween and especially DIY Halloween hairstyles!  This Halloween hairstyle does not disappoint in any way.  You will love this amazing DIY Halloween Hairstyle: Mermaid hairstyle edition and get so many compliments!

videos.title: Double Knotted Braids | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Be sure to check back here on Wednesday night (7pm CST) for a special BONUS video that our family filmed for you! It's been something we've talked about doing for several years now, but just wasn't able to find the time until now!

Also, click here to win 1 of BrooklynAndBailey's Back-to-School Backpacks + Supplies + iPad Mini! (Two winners will be chosen!)
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/BBGiveBackpacks

We used to do this hairstyle on Brooklyn & Bailey all the time when they were younger. Not sure why we stopped doing it, but I recently saw a picture of it in my old hairstyle photo album, so there you go!

We sometimes call this the shoelace braid, since the concept of the braid is similar to the first step of tying a show. Only to make a braid, you simply add in hair to each side before tying your next knot.

It's pretty easy once you get the hang of it. You can do this on any braid, or in a hairstyle combo.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDblKnotBraids

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us what you think our special video will be on Wednesday!

üíã's -Mindy

videos.title: Double Bubble Fishtail Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
We uploaded another vlog today, not here, but over on Millennial Moms! It's a video where you get to follow us around on a day we went to Six Flags theme park! To watch the video, be sure to click HERE!

Want to win our 13" MacBook Air + 2 CGH T-Shirts GIVEAWAY? Click here to enter... http://gleam.io/G8TR3/macbook-air-2-cgh-tshirts-giveaway
_

Learn how to create this "windowed" Double Bubble Fishtail Braid in just a few minutes! It's such a beautiful hairstyle, that your friends will be trying to figure out how you did it all day!

Inspiration from this hairstyle came from one of our Instagram braiding friends, Vlechtidee, from the Netherlands. You can follow her IG account here: http://www.instagram.com/vlechtidee

We've been doing bubble braid combos for years, but this is the first time we have ever tried it with windows! Such a pretty concept, and you get the look by simply adding in ab extra rubber band before starting each section!

Don't know what I am talking about? Be sure to watch the video! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our CGH app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDoubleBubbleBraid

videos.title: 3-in-1 Double Dutch Braids| Build-able Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I'm in love with build-able hair styles right now. A build-able hairstyle   is basically a number of hairstyles that build upon each other. To get to the second hairstyle, you have to finish the first hairstyle and so on...  I really love build-able hairstyles because everyone has days where you start with you hair one way but need to transition the hair quickly later that day.  This is a simple way to do that!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGH3xDoubleDutch

videos.title: 2-in-1 Angel Wing Combo + EXCITING NEWS!!!
videos.description:
Check out Brooklyn & Bailey's most recent video, a "Twin vs Twin" challenge! It'll have you laughing! Click HERE... http://youtu.be/OGCjA1mxssg

It's time for another 2-in1 combo hairstyle, and it is simply beautiful! This was originally only a half-up style and is inspired by Cynthia Truong. You can see Cynthia's tutorial here: http://youtu.be/iRzo7iWtews

We've been doing tiebacks and half-up styles on CHG here for years, and there are many favorites that my girls just LOVE! This one is no exception!

The pattern created by style's stranding looks very much like angel wings, don't you think? We added a loose fishtail braid and micro-crimps add texture and complete the combo.

To see your photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos on IG with: #CGHAngelWingCombo

videos.description:

This week's Woven Updo hairstyle tutorial doesn't use a new braid technique, as basket weaves like this have existed in hair for centuries. I was also inspired by Hairstyles68 on Facebook.  We did place our own variation into it by rolling the braid up into a super cute updo. 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHWovenUpdo

There are countless combinations you can do with the base braid, too. This hairstyle can be worn for pretty much any occasion (except for active sports), and dressed either up or down, depending on your preference.

I really loved how this Woven Updo turned out, and it looks great from all angles! I can see this being great for Prom, Homecoming, weddings, work, or for flower girls, etc.

Brooklyn settled for this Half-Up Rosette Combo, a combination of two loose Dutchbacks on top into a Rosette bun, with the rest of the hair down in loose curls.

The great part about a combo hairstyle is that with the basic braid and bun styles, combined on loose, wavy, or curly hair... your options really are limitless.

videos.description:
Be sure to watch BrooklynAndBailey's 2015 Fall Fashion Lookbook HERE! http://youtu.be/3cHY_09-56M?list=UU6QWhGQqf0YDYdRb0n6ojWw

Today we are going to show you how to create a Lattice Braid Combo. 

This hairstyle is a variation of a style we uploaded three years ago that called Ladder Braid Combo. {You can see that tutorial here... http://youtu.be/PU1pEtcQxHk} 

Kamri is back as my volunteer model today. We begin this style, again, with a Feather Braid and then finish it off with a Lace Braid... only we are crossing the feathered strands this time. This is what gives the braid its Lattice look.

You can adjust the lengths of the X's simply creating the bottom Lace Braid higher or lower.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHLatticeBraid

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us what other hairstyles you would love to see here!

It's Bailey here today, showing y'all how to create these beautiful Fold-Up Braids on Brooklyn... a perfect hairstyle for Back-to-School season!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHFoldUpBraids

videos.description:

__

This week's tutorial uses a braid you've all heard of before, the Infinity Braid, and pulls two of them back into a beautiful tieback with curls. 

Tiebacks have been some our most favorite hairstyles over the years, simply because they pull the hair out of your face, and add a perfect accent to straight, wavy, or curly hair. 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our CGH App, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHInfinityTieback

In this video, I give you a few Tips & Tricks to getting the braid to look right, and even show you how I wear this as a side braid.

This hairstyle is perfect for women and girls of all ages, and in any number of combinations. I would, however, recommend that you have long to medium hair length for this style, however shorter braids could work on short hair.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us when you go back to school!

videos.description:
Have you watched both of our videos, including a BONUS VIDEO from last week? You can find them here: 
http://youtu.be/hDYc6HPDN3U 
http://youtu.be/V3oIsGkS-iI
__

This week's tutorial combines features we have shown you how to do before. A Sock Bun and a Hair Bow. This combo has been around a long time, as it has been perfected fabulously by several of our friends on Instagram, including Kimberly0706 and Chicas_Chic. Be sure to check them out!

You can create a sock bun with a hair "donut", or bun maker, as they are called, or you can create a bun former by cutting the toe out of a tube sock and rolling the sock up. 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBowBun

This updo hairstyle is adorable, and would be perfect for Prom or Homecoming, but equally a beautiful for ballet or dance. It can be dressed up, or down, depending on your mood and style. Kamri prefers to wear this with just about anything, like the denim shirt and white jeans she wore in this video.

Because this bun already has a bow in it, there isn't any need for accessories!

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëç" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us what your plans are for this SUMMER!

videos.title: Dutch 3D Braid | Hairstyles for Sports
videos.description:
Watch Jill's first tutorial on CGH by clicking HERE!
https://youtu.be/w5l-NKSOWFY

Last month we invited Jill Ehat {http://www.instagram.com/jehat} to guest post here on CGH with her adorable Flower Bun Hawk tutorial! All of you received her so well, that we decided to invite her back with another BONUS video this week!

Today Jill and one of her cute 6-yr-old twins, Brighton, will be showing us how to create a Dutch 3D Braid. This style is a perfect "active" hairstyle for sports, dance, gymanstics, cheer, etc, but can also be worn as a very cute everyday style!

You may want to try this braid on someone else before creating on yourself. Because you are working with 4 strands, and adding in hair on the sides, it may take a little practice to get the stranding down. What we can say, is that this braid is... BEAUTIFUL!

{If you have thin hair, you can add grip and volume to it by using a texturizing iron. The iron gives the hair a micro crimp that really helps amplify the look of braids on thinner hair.} 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDutch3DBraid

Be sure to let Jill know in the comments if you loved her tutorial! You can also do so by giving this video a BIG "üëç", and also feel free to leave a comment below telling us your favorite sport!

üíã's -Mindy

videos.title: The Tuxedo Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Watch our family vlog from our Spring Break in Dubai, by clicking HERE!
https://youtu.be/vNGDv0zPths

This braid has been on my list for about 8 months, one that we've done from time to time on the girls after seeing it on the red carpet. 

Kamri calls this the Tuxedo Braid, because the inside Dutch Braid looks like the ruffles of a vintage tuxedo, with the outer loose French Braid acting like the jacket of the tux.

This braid, having been around awhile, has also been called a Peek-A-Boo Braid.  I am not sure where the style originated, but recently Diane Kruger wore it to the 2014 Fashion Awards show.  One of our viewers, Gabi, even emailed me a photo for a much more relaxed version of this from Cosmopolitan magazine's website {http://www.cosmopolitan.com/style-beauty/beauty/how-to/a31363/hair-how-to-peek-a-boo-braid/}.  We decided to bump it up the list and finally film a tutorial on it.  While I like Cosmo's interpretation, the one we've done has always been a higher hide of the Dutch Braid, just like a tux's jacket. Thanks for the nudge, Gabi!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHTuxedoBraid

I would recommend trying this hairstyle on someone else first, just to get the hang of the centering for both braids. You can do it tight, or loose, it all depends on the look you are trying to create. Feel free to use hairspray or spray wax to help hold in flyaways.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëç" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us if you've watched our family's Spring Break in Dubai vlog {link above}.

üíã's -Mindy

videos.title: Loop Waterfall Braid | Cute Hairstyles
videos.description:
Only 2 days left to enter BrooklynAndBailey's HUGE iPad Mini Giveaway!
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/ipadgiveaway

_________

Love the Waterfall Braid? Learn how to create this Loop Waterfall Braid for a perfect hairstyle that your friends will adore! We'll teach you the EASIEST braid stitching for this braid possible, so that everyone can do it!

One of our viewers, Bethany, emailed us a photo of this style from Pinterest and by tracing back it looks like it was from a Russian website that I cannot read. It ended up being Shaun who figured out the braid technique just from looking at the picture for 15 seconds! I didn't believe him, but, yes, I have to eat my words!

The technique essentially entails creating a loop with one small strand of hair. Then reach through that loop and pull a new small section of hair half-way through a loop, and then flipping it upside down to create a new loop. Then repeating the process across the back of the head. Then you can go back and adjust the size of the loops later, to your liking.

This isn't a hairstyle that we would recommend for an active day, as the loops and bobby pins will fall out. The Loop Waterfall is simply beautiful hairstyle for those days when you just want to wear something gorgeous! 

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHLoopWaterfall

You can use the Loop Waterfall as part of a combo, even updos, which makes it perfect for Prom or Homecoming!

I PROMISE... you will receive compliments ALL DAY when wearing this hairstyle! Not only will they love how it looks, but they'll also want to know how you did it! Enjoy!

üíã's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray water bottle, spray hair wax, pomade, 4 small bobby pins, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

This week's tutorial uses a Lace Braid, only instead of adding hair only into the top, as we've shown you in several tutorials, you only add hair into the bottom!

The effect that this braid gives you is a "faux waterfall braid" look, only no hair actually falls through the braid. 

To see your own photo recreations featured in our CGH app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHUpwardLaceBraid

I think this braid looks the best brought back into a tieback, however you can continue this braid around the back of the head and secured behind the other ear.

This technique works on curly hair, wavy hair, straight hair, wet hair, dry hair, Day 2 hair, etc. Really, you can use it to accent pretty much any hairstyle!

videos.title: Katniss' Mockingjay Braid | Hunger Games Hairstyles
videos.description:
Click here to see more hairstyles from The Hunger Games movies: 
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLC0E435779246B4E5
____________________

Many of you know that were are HUGE fans of The Hunger Games books and movie franchise! We've been friends with Linda Flowers, the Department Head of Hair & Makeup for both The Hunger Games and Catching Fire ever since we first put up the Katniss braid years ago. Since Linda had a contract for Dancing With The Stars, she was unable to work on the Mockingly movies, with Lionsgate instead hiring Camille Friend. Camille is just as talented, and her team did an amazing job trying to have the hair reflect the mood of the war-trodden State, as in the book.

Katniss' braid in this 3rd movie isn't supposed to be focused so much on style, as her time in the Capitol and in the Games merited. This time around, Panem is at war, with a growing rebellion movement, and the look is supposed to fully reflect that. 

Things aren't as they once were, and that's why there is a fundamental change in the Katniss braid.

Katniss still wears a side braid, which as Linda told us is to ensure that she doesn't snag her braid as she removes arrows from the quiver on her back. This time around, the wrapping braids from the left and right are French braids instead of Katniss' signature Dutch braid. For the side braid, the stitching looks very similar to a Simple braid, however it really is a chunky Reverse Fishtail. The look is also supposed to be somewhat messy and disheveled, which is the look we were going for. {The wind and rain in our trailer video shoot certainly helped with that!}

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHMockingjayBraid

Hope you enjoyed this video, and if you did... please give it a big "Thumbs Up"! Be sure to join us next week for another Mockingjay hairstyle tutorial!

üíã's -Mindy

Items Needed: 19mm Curling Wand, brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 small hair elastics, scissors, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 7-10 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.title: How to Create a Banded Puff Braid | Cute Hairstyles
videos.description:
Click this link to watch BrooklynAndBailey's "Meet our Little Brother" video: http://youtu.be/-prosDBMIKs

Please give the video a "Like" if you think Brooklyn looks gorgeous in the intro! {Goal: 20,000 Likes}
_________________________

A few months ago my friend from high school, Alicia, shared a photo with me of this hairstyle that she simply could not figure out. At first, I couldn't either. 

It took a few weeks, but the girls and I finally cracked the code, and want to share with you how to create this beautiful faux braid hairstyle!

You are actually using small banded tiebacks to create this style, threading your newest one under and up through, and over the top of the previous one. Then as you go, you pancake the stitches. You can do as few or many as you want, it is entirely up to you!

It may seem confusing at first, as it was for me, but as you go along, the puff braid will take shape and you will LOVE it!

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHBandedPuffBraid

We are stopped every time we go out when one of us wears this braid! You can leave this as is, or finish the bottom ponytail into a braid and tuck and roll it all up and underneath the puff braid for a beautiful updo. Your options really are limitless!

What do you think of this hairstyle? Feel free to leave a comment below!

üíã's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 10-12 small hair elastics, hairspray or hair wax, accessory {if desired}.

________________________________

Our goal for this video is 25,000 Likes, can you help us get there?

________________________________

This week's hairstyle uses a similar technique as our Lace Braided Heart, only our purpose here is to highlight the front parting of the hair and not so much the back.

The trick is to get your Lace Braid started, since you are using such a micro strand to begin with, but once you have it, this braid is really a cinch!

We love how boho {or bohemian} this look gives us, very much a hippie vibe without overdoing it.

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHBohoLaceTieback

This hairstyle accent can work on long, medium, or short hair, and is perfect for any occasion. It holds up well in sports {minus the accessory} and can be used as a wedding or communion hairstyle. It can be worn with curly, wavy, or straight hair, and can be accessorized in any number of ways.

Please leave a comment below letting us know what other types of hairstyles you would like to see us feature!

videos.description:
Want to see me do the Chubby Bunny Challenge? üê∞ I almost wet my pants from laughing so hard while doing it! üòÇ http://youtu.be/1IKQXdVzZ-c
____________________________

My niece, who is four years old, who also had such beautiful, long curly hair, just had her little friend give her a "hair cut" last week! 

She now has a chin-length adorable bob haircut, so we decided to upload a short hairstyle today, showing you how to create the Laced Fishtail Tieback!

I originally tried with two lace-backs, but found that they winged out too much when I pancaked them. Although I loved how they looked, pinned down, I couldn't get them to stay down. So I decided to start each side with a few French Braid stitches to anchor the two braid backs. This trick worked perfectly!  

If you want to see your recreations of this style featured in our CHG App, feel free to tag your own photos with: #CGHLaceFishtailTieback

This hairstyle is perfect for girls with short hair, medium hair, or long hair. It can be worn for any occasion, with straight or curls, too!

Everyone is always asking for hairstyles that can be worn for athletics, such as dance, cheer, softball, soccer, running, etc.

I am a huge Lulu Lemon fan, and follow them on Instagram, and saw this hairstyle come up on my Instagram feed. I just had to learn it, and then teach all of you!

To see your recreations featured in our CGH App, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHRunBraidCombo

If you know how to French and simple braid, you really are good to go! This will keep the hair pulled out of your face, and your hair up off of your neck.

We are calling this a combo because you are combining several different braid styles into the look... French, simple, and rope braiding.

This happens to be one of Brooklyn's favorite braids right now, and leads to absolutely gorgeous 2nd-Day Curls the next day!

If you are reading this, please comment "Sports" below!

videos.title: How to Create a Double Dutchback | Heidi Klum Hairstyles
videos.description:
Have you visited our website http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com? We have about 20 more hairstyles on there from before our YouTube days!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

My dad is so cute! You see, he is so proud of our family, our fans,  and what this CGH YouTube channel has accomplished! He's always texting or emailing us photos of hairstyles he sees when he is running errands, or watching TV!

Several weeks ago he emailed me a photo of a hairstyle worn by Heidi Klum, from America's Got Talent. In the email, he hinted that we "should seriously film a video of it"!

Dad, this one is for you!

The hairstyle consists of two Dutch braids on only one side of the head, that wrap down and underneath the back of the head, where they braids are tied off with an hair elastic.

This cute hairstyle provides an "edgy" look that would be perfect for competitive dance or cheer teams. {I can foresee several dance groups wearing this one, for sure!} 

This style can also be worn for several days, and looks adorable with straight, curly, or wavy hair! If you are careful with it, you can wear it for several days in a row, too!


Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHDoubleDutchback

It is another way to get the "shaved" without committing to a razor and half bald head! We've shave another single-sides-up style on the channel, and it was a popular one. You can see it here:

Side Flat Twists: http://youtu.be/I153MibXY2w

Please leave a comment below letting me know what TV shows you love where they show great hair! I'd like to know!

As always, don't forget to Like, Favorite, Comment, and SHARE!

üíã - Mindy

videos.description:

This braid concept is nothing new, in fact we filmed a Side Fishtail Combo featuring this concept back in 2011. Looks like it finally made traction!

If you know how to fishtail braid, pancake it, and add a mini hair wrap... then this will be easy! Here I will show you a trick to securing the hair wraps, and we incorporated the bubble ponytail look from a previous video, with multiple segments here, to enhance the combo.

To see your recreations of this hairstyle featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHBubbleFishtail

We chose for this to be a half-up, half-down hairstyle, with light curls as the base. For younger girls, you can pull all the hair into it from above the ears, leaving the rest down. This will give a more pulled-back look.

You can add as many bubble segments as you wish, which will mostly depend on the length of your hair.

Enjoy!

videos.title: Half-Loop Braidback | Back-to-School Hairstyles
videos.description:
Be sure to subscribe to BrooklynAndBailey's channel, because the girls' "Back-to-School" Series begins on Wednesday! You won't want to miss them! Click here: http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/BBsubscribe

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Today's tutorial is inspired by a fan named Sophia {@BraidsBySophia on Instagram}, who posted a photo of this after being inspired by our French Loop Braid a few weeks ago! Now it has come full circle! {@AnniesForgetMeKnots also posted a beautiful variation of this braid!}

We love tiebacks because they are very mature looking, and can be worn with straight, wavy, or curly hair as the base. I promise, you will receive so many compliments on this one!

Using the Loop Braid technique, which incorporates skip-stitching of feathers strands from the braid, you can dress up any braid. This version uses simple braids, but you may also do this to French, Dutch, and Lace Braids.

To see your recreations featured in our CGH App, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHHalfLoopBraidback

This style is categorized as "Medium" in skill level only because the skip-stitching can be confusing. Be sure to watch the video carefully to know when to bring back in a previously-feathered strand.

Don't you think this is beautiful? On what occasions would you wear this? Perfect for Back-to-School, right?

Have a great week!

üòò -Mindy

DISCOUNT: For the first 2 weeks {until May 11th, 2014} the Premium upgrade will be only $0.99. After that date, the price will go up to its standard rate.

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

As Spring is full underway, with lots of Proms going one, Kamri and I wanted to teach you a variation of a style we showed you last year. This is called a 3D Flower Bun.

To see our original 3D Round Braid, click here: http://youtu.be/eeCOdeC7S7k

We use the exact 3D Round Braid as the base of this hairstyle, however my good friend Abby Smith {http://www.youtube.com/TwistMePretty} suggested us to add a "pancake" accent to it.  All you have to do is gently tug "pancake" on the elbows of the braid, to add volume to the braid, and then wrap it up around itself into a bun. This creates a gorgeous flower bun effect, with the pancaking acting as flower petals!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGH3DFlowerBun

Yes, lots of compliments on this one... GUARANTEED! Thanks to Kamri for volunteering to be our model!

Enjoy!

videos.title: 3 Ways to Wear a Celtic Knot | St. Patrick's Day Hairstyles
videos.description:
Learn how to recreate Elsa's Coronation Updo from Disney's "Frozen", here: http://youtu.be/Vl-8jueZ7NE

With St. Patrick's Day just around the corner, we wanted to upload a tutorial to celebrate our family's Irish/Scottish heritage {from both sides of the family}... a hairstyle I have wanted to do for a long time. The Celtic Knot.

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHCelticKnots

The Celtic Knot has been around for centuries, traditionally used to adorn religious sculptures and various kinds of artwork. You can find several versions of this knot in hairstyle form on Pinterest, as well as a few YouTube tutorials.

Today, Brooklyn and I wanted to create variations of this knot using curls as the base.  Brooklyn just used her NuMe curling wand to achieve the curls.  

Here we show you three versions, a Single Celtic Knot, a Double Celtic Knot, and a Side Celtic Knot.  Believe it or not, but the side version is my favorite!

Now, because this is a winding knot, using only two strands, it can be very confusing to learn how to tie.  This is why I showed you how to tie the knot "three" times in the video, hoping that the repetition will help.

I also show you a helpful tip which is useful in helping the knot to keep its shape, and to also help the falling strands lay flat.

Enjoy!

xoxo
-Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, pomade, and hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 2-3 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.description:
If you are looking for the hair Wrap-Up tool, you can find one here: https://www.joyus.com/beauty/1-445/the-tool-for-easy-updos-hosted-by-mikaela-south?utm_source=paid-ads-cute-girl-hairstyles&utm_medium=banner-ads&utm_content=cute-girl&utm_campaign=PCG02NA0001

Expires: 12/30/2013

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHFrenchUpHighBun

See more photos and written step-by-step instructions for this hairstyle at:
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/?p=6938

Joyus teamed up with CGH to provide you this cute bun idea that has been very popular during 2013, except I am using a hair bun tool that I have been carrying around in my purse for months!

In fact, the past two days we found our neighborhood without electricity and heat for two days, after an awful ice storm here in Dallas! Yes, we were freezing, but did have a few fireplaces going to provide heat.  That being said, there wasn't any way to shower, or curl my hair without getting sick, so I instead exclusively relied on hair buns!

This bun style uses a French-Up technique, which we had shown briefly in a video two years ago, but never filmed a full tutorial for it.  I love the French-Up High Bun, and since it was the style I wore for those two days with out electricity, we felt it appropriate to show you how to create it!

{If you are careful CHG tutorial viewers, you will notice that this is the exact same tool that  Brooklyn used on me in the DisneyStyle video we posted a few months ago!  You can see the video here... http://youtu.be/W2Cj86-MBfw}

Enjoy!

videos.title: How to get Prim's Bow Braid Tieback | Catching Fire | Hunger Games Hairstyles
videos.description:
Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHPrimBowBraid

Is that our Bow Braid Headband you see on Prim in the reaping scene of The Hunger Games "Catching Fire"? Why, yes, it is!  

Over a year ago, Linda Flowers, the Head Hairstylist for Lionsgate's "The Hunger Games" movie franchise, called me to ask if she could use our Bow Braid in the movie.  Of course, we were thrilled!  

Linda then invited my husband and I to be on set for the day they were filming the Tribute Chariot Scene. Yes, we did get to meet the stars and enjoyed consulting on hairstyles!

Today we wanted to show you the first official hairstyle tutorial for Prim's Bow Braid Tieback.  CGH#3 is my model, and don't you think she looks so much like Prim???

We have shown you how to create a bow braid before, via the following tutorials:
* Diagonal Bow Braid http://youtu.be/EGbUXBi7DHk

* Bow Braid Headband http://youtu.be/9d7hxQ9Cvhw

We have also shown you several Hunger Games Tutorials, as follows:
* Wrap-Around Prim Braid http://youtu.be/S58rM0Fi7oo
* Authentic Katniss Braid http://youtu.be/CpVnRZJCGhI

videos.description:

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

My voice has not yet recovered from being sick, so Bailey offered to film one of her hairstyles today... which I felt was very thoughtful.

Many of you have seen our Loony Braid tutorials, and this is a variation of it using ribbon.  It creates such a unique and beautifully-accented braid, and can be done in about 2 minutes!  All you need to know is how to create a simple 3-strand braid.  If you can do that, this hairstyle is a cinch!

Enjoy!

Time Requirement: 2-3 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

videos.description:
Want to become CGH braid certified??? Simply tag your own photo of this braid with #CGHBoxFishtail on Instagram!  Don't forget that you can follow us on IG: http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

From time to time, a fan will submit a hairstyle photo of their own creation and it will literally BLOW my mind!  Kendra from Canada sent me a version of this braid she had created that I absolutely loved!  We think this will be a big hit, and wanted to credit her in this video.

Yes, this is a fishtail braid... but it is a fishtail braid on A:: FOUR sides of the ponytail! The front and back are regular fishtail looks, while the two sides are reverse fishtails! 

To create this look, you combine alternating double stitches of a fishtail braid with a reverse fishtail... 

Click here to learn how to fishtail braid: http://youtu.be/DXh5Wv6z0ho
Click here to learn how to reverse fishtail braid: http://youtu.be/QUZg4bccwjk

Also, to make a beautiful updo... simply twist the braid up into itself to create a magnificent-looking bun that would be perfect for ballet, a wedding, Homecoming, Prom, or any other occasion!

You will definitely love this hairstyle because you will receive compliments all day long!  If you love this braid, please feel free to share this video!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1-2 hair band/ponytail holders, 1 small hair elastic, 1 bobby pin, hairspray and accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 8-10 minutes

Skill Level: Medium {only because it is time consuming and your arms get tired!}

videos.title: Lace Braided {Sophia Lucia} Bun | Updo Hairstyles
videos.description:
Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHLaceBraidedBun

I have been trying to perfect this lace braided bun for two months now, and FINALLY figured out a trick to getting it to look perfect!  If you have learned from our Lace Braid tutorials, this updo will be a so easy for you!

The trick was to isolate out a small strand of hair before placing the bun maker into the hair.  This strand serves as your base to anchor the lace braid, which keeps the braid firm around the bottom of the bun.

The style holds up nicely throughout the day, and is a perfect updo for Prom or Homecoming, or to be worn casually on any other day!  I love hairstyles like that!

CGH#3 volunteered to be my model, and isn't she adorable?

Enjoy!

xoxo

Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 bun maker, 1 large hair band, 1 small hair elastic, 3-4 bobby pins, hairspray {if desired}.

videos.title: Reverse {Inverse} Fishtail Braid | Thanks for 1,000,000 Subscribers!
videos.description:
Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHReverseFishtail

I know that Fishtail Braids are raging right now, particularly any that deviate a little from the standard fishtail braid.  We have seen photos on Pinterest of this style, but I did not know how to create one.

As you know, the stitches on a standard Fishtail Braid have a "v" pattern.  Well, a Reverse {or Inverse} Fishtail Braid has a "^" pattern which is very different than what you see around.

I spent a few hours last week practicing on my mannequin head, and as I completed the first five stitches or so, it seemed like I was doing something wrong! Just when I figured I would give up, all of the sudden... the braid popped out!  A beautiful inverse herringbone pattern!

I then recreated it on CGH#3, and had her show Bailey, her older sister.  Bailey quickly asked... "How did you do that?  I want to learn it!"  So, last week, we were pretty much wearing reverse fishtail braids every day!

Hope you enjoy, and if you do... please feel free to share!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 hair band, 1 small hair elastic, hairspray and accessory {if desired}. 

Time Requirement: 5-8 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.title: 4-Strand "Slide-Up" Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Lately my girls and I have really been loving pullbacks, specifically anything that pulls hair to the side, or from both sides.  We think it looks so subtle and effortless, but still has a polished and super cute look!   

One of my new favorites is this 4-Strand Slide-Up Braid.  Although it may seem tricky at first, once you get the hang of it... you will find this braid to be a quick style that garners a lot of attention!  We first posted the 3-Strand Slide-Up Braid on YouTube in December 2009 and it has nearly 6,000,000 views today!  You can see that tutorial here... http://youtu.be/s2n5XkFh88A

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGH4StrandSlideUp

For this four-strand version, we show you two methods to create the braid... both ending with the exact same look!  Simply find which one makes the most sense to you, and go with it!  I am all about making things easier for you!

You can do a single pullback, or create another one on the other side of the head and tie them back together.  {You can also use this braid as a cute braided headband by bringing one up over the top of the head like a headband!  If you do this, be sure your strands are think so that the width of the braid is uniform all the way down, rather than wide to thin.}
 
Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 6 small hair elastics, hairspray, accessory {if desired}
 
Time Requirement: 5-10 minutes

Skill Level:  Medium

Enjoy!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

I have been working these past few weeks on a few updo hairstyle ideas, and this is the first one.

Many of you know that my girls LOVE "pancaked" braids... so we decided to film this updo incorporating one.  As you know, pancake braid is essentially a braid with the elbows tugged out, expanding/flattening the braid.  {We Dutch braided from the top of the head all the way down the back.}

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHDoubleTwistPancake

We then took two sections on either side of the head and twisted them, messed them up a bit, and twisted them around the bottom of the pancake braid, and pinned them.  

The finished look is beautiful!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 small elastic band, 2-4 bobby pins, hairspray or accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5-7 minutes

We have had lots of fans asking for Halloween Hairstyles, and many had asked if there was a way to make cat ears using hair {rather than using the pre-made cat ear headbands}.

Well... there is, and our CGH#4 volunteered to be our model!  

All I used were two black pipe cleaners for each cat ear, braiding the two pipe cleaners as the "third" strand of a 3-strand braid.  Then you can bend the finished braid into a point and continue on to fashion the kitty cat ear!  You then repeat the same step on the other side.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHBraidedCatEars

While finishing this style, we also suggest that you can use red pipe cleaners to create devil horns if you wish to be a Little Red Devil for Halloween, as well!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 4 hair elastics, 4 long black pipe cleaners, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5-7 minutes

I was browsing through our old video files and found a Halloween video from 2011 that we had never uploaded to YouTube!  It was so cute, I just had to upload it this year!

The hairstyle uses two lace braids, and for purposes of the Woodland Fairy costume, I left the braids down.  But... I do show you how you can fold up the braids in the back for a gorgeous updo that is perfect for any formal occasion, including weddings, proms, homecomings, dinners, etc.

At the end, I provide a 2 minute clip of all of the kids in costume!  Look how little they all were... especially Sweet Pea!  The hardest part of being a parent is recognizing how fast your children grow up!  You have to notice CGH#4's reaction when I say that she is a Spanish girl... HILARIOUS!!!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHWoodlandFairyBraids

{By way of update... my hubby's father was admitted to the hospital that night with bleeding in his brain, stayed in the hospital for four days, and then released.  He has been in good health ever since!}

This is a 3rd-day hairstyle on my daughter, after she used a high twisty bun on Day 1, took it out and left subtle curls with a pullback on top for Day 2, and this ponytail style on Day 3.

My girls and I have been wearing this ponytail hairstyle for some time now, in fact, I Instagrammed a photo of me wearing this style when I was in LA a few weeks ago.  http://www.instagram.com/cutegirlshairstyles {Instagram}

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHDoubleFrenchPony

This easy ponytail incorporates a pullback {pompadour} on top and French braided side sections brought up with the remaining hair into a high pony.  I then take a small strand of hair from the ponytail and wrap it around the elastic band.  

You will find that this is a super cute ponytail hairstyle that is sure to get you compliments, and is perfect for cheer, gymnastics, other sports, or simply to wear around any day!

Enjoy!

We are actually uploading two videos today, this Pin Curl Accent video here and another one {Belle's hairstyle from the ballroom scene of Disney's "Beauty and the Beast"} on the DisneyStyle channel at the following link...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QSmccOegvDk

We wanted to teach you something you can do to accent any number to hairstyles.  These pin coils are easy to form and look a lot like rosettes.  

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHPinCurlAccents

You form them by wrapping a hair strand around your first two fingers, and then sliding the hair coil off of the fingers and bobby pinning it flat against the head.  You repeat the same process for a few more pin curls.

These accents can be used paired up with a messy bun {as I also show you in the video}, or with braids, twists, and it is also a very popular way to dress up an updo for Prom or Homecoming!

Enjoy!

Items Needed:  3-4 small bobby, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 3-5 minutes

videos.description:

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

So many fans have been emailing me about hairstyles from the "Game of Thrones" HBO television series.  I do not watch the series, however I have seen the photos fans have sent in and though I would highlight one of them that I thought was easy and super cute!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGH2FrenchBraidTwist

We call this one the "Double French Braid and Twist".  To begin, center-part the hair and then section off about a 1.5 inch strip on either side of the part.  {These sections will provide the hair for the two French backs.}

As your French backs reach as far back as the crown of the head, ended them into simple braids.  Then take the braids and twist them around each other, tying them off together with a hair elastic.

We added some volume to the hair before we made this braid, simply to add more texture to the hairstyle.  This is a perfect 2nd-day hairstyle if you wore braids or had curls the previous day.

Enjoy!

videos.description:
To see more photos of this style, please visit...
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

I receive so many requests for hairstyles that you can do on yourself, especially for  moms who work or career women in general.

There are many styles that I do on myself in a pinch, that take literally 3-5 minutes to do.  This French Braid & Tuck is one of the easiest!  All you do is finger-comb your hair back and begin a "chunky" {large sections of hair} French Braid.  After about 3 braid overs, finish the rest of the hair into a simple braid.  Then simply create a hole on the underside of the braid, and then tuck the tail of the braid underneath the French section of the hairstyle! 

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHFrenchBraidTuck

The result is a very simple, yet sophisticated hairstyle that is perfect for the office, or simply to wear around!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, 1 hairband, 2-3 bobby pins, hairspray {if desired}

Time Requirement: 3 minutes

videos.title: Authentic Katniss Braid | Hunger Games Special Guest | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
To see more photos of this style, please visit...
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

...and follow us at our other social hangouts!

http://www.facebook.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

TopStyler is offering a USD$49.99 special price {and free shipping to the US and Puerto Rico} on the TopStyler to our fans... this is a over a 50% discount!  They are also offering a discount on the InStyler as well! Here is the discount link: http://www.instyleroffer.com/topstyler

We uploaded our 1st version of the Katniss Braid several months before the movie came out.  Right after the movie premier, Linda Flowers, the lead hairstylist on The Hunger Games movie set, personally reached out to CuteGirlsHairstyles when she saw how popular our tutorial was!  Can you believe it... she reached out to US!!!

Linda was so amazed at how iconic the Katniss Braid became, so much that teen girls were wearing the braid to see the movie in theaters!  She recognized that CuteGirlsHairstyles helped in teaching thousands of our fans how to do the braid! As such, Linda offered to give me a "personal" tutorial of the many Hunger Games hairstyles over Skype!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHTrueKatnissBraid

During our tutorial, I quickly saw that Katniss' style had a little more to it than what I had originally thought!  Linda showed me how she added the texture into Jennifer Lawrence's hair "before" she created the Katniss braid {something I had not figured out}.  She uses a tool called the TopStyler¬Æ {by InStyler¬Æ} to add volume and stranded twists into the diagonal Dutch braid.  I show you how to do this in the tutorial.

You can find the TopStyler at Target, Bed Bath & Beyond, Ulta, or online at the following link...

http://www.topstyler.com/

I appreciate that the TopStyler uses a slow and uniform transfer heat to curl the hair, rather than the immediate hot heat a curling wand provides that only heats the outside of the strand.

This is the exact look Katniss wore throughout the arena scenes in the movie, taught to CuteGirlsHairstyles personally by the one who created it... Linda Flowers!

Enjoy!

FTC Disclosure:  I was provided this TopStyler¬Æ tool free of charge by InStyler¬Æ for review purposes only.  No other forms of compensation were provided to CuteGirlsHairstyles.  All opinions of the product are strictly mine, and results may vary.

http://www.pinterest.com/MrsHairdo
http://www.instagram/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

I receive so many requests for hairstyles that you can do on yourself, especially for  moms who work or career women in general.

There are many styles that I do on myself in a pinch, that take literally 3-5 minutes to do.  This Ponytail {Gibson} Tuck is one of the easiest!  All you do is finger-comb your hair back into a ponytail, but on the last twist of the elastic... you pull the ponytail half way through.  

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHPonytailTuck

Then you twist the ponytail/bun so that the ends flip up.  Simply create a hole at the base of the ponytail {like you would if you were to flip the ponytail with a Topsy Tail} and begin stuffing the ponytail through the hole.

The result is a very simple, yet sophisticated hairstyle that is perfect for the office, or simply to wear around!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, 1 hairband, 2-3 bobby pins, hairspray {if desired}

Time Requirement: 3 minutes

I mentioned when we filmed the Lady Gaga Hair Bow tutorial that I had another variation to do on short hair.  This is it!

A fan posted her version of this hairstyle back in May 2011 and I promised to do a tutorial on it {it just took awhile to get down to it on my list}.  We love these hair bows because they fit wonderfully on all girls... even girls with short hair!  Jenn, another hairblogging friend of mine, also did a variation of these here... http://tinyurl.com/bowpiggies 

For a more grown-up "half-up-half-down" hairstyle, you can do twistbacks {or braid backs} from the front along the sides that are then tied together in the back.  Then complete this bow in the remaining ponytail, with the rest of the hair down in curls.  Super cute!

Enjoy!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Perhaps one of my most frequent requests is for the Katniss braid from the Hunger Games movie trailer.  I did quite a bit of research to find the best angles to view it, and with a little help from Lindsey {a loyal fan}, we had a perfect view of the style!

The hairstyle uses a Dutch Braid starting on the front of the right side of the head and braiding back across the head in a diagonal until you finish off the hair with a braid over the left shoulder.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHKatnissBraid

{I have a perfect tutorial of how to do this type of Dutch braiding here...  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mNAghknB5g8}

Now, this braid is supposed to look messy since Katniss was wearing this hairstyle in the arena during the games.  I used a few hair extensions to add length to the braid, but my layers were perfect as some stuck out in the braid... just like Katniss!

I know this will be a popular braid, once the movie comes out on March 23, so you can help make this braid a viral sensation by referring it to all your girl friends on YT, Twitter, and Facebook!  That way millions of girls will wear this hairstyle to the theaters to see the movie!

Enjoy!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

If you like the Waterfall Braid hairstyle, you will also like this Cage Braid.  It is super easy to do, and uses the basic French Braiding technique with a small twist to the stranding.

When you are done with the braid, you simply grab the center part of the braid about two inches down and pull it up on top of the ponytail and the whole braid literally "pops" out into this super cute 3D braid!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHCageBraid

It is called a cage braid because the braid effect looks like a ribcage.  This would be a perfect Halloween hairstyle with heart bobby pin stuck in the right side of the cage... or a fun Christmas hairstyle because the braid could be decorated as a tree!

Enjoy!

videos.title: The Waterfall Braid {Plait} | Popular Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
This YouTube's first-ever clearly-explained and filmed demonstration of the Waterfall Braid! My daughter is the one who gave it this name, because she felt it looked like a waterfall over a cliff's edge.

 To see more photos of this style, please visit...
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

Want to become a "Super Fan" of the week, and potentially have your photo appear in a future video?  Simply email us a photo of you doing something crazy or fun while wearing a CGH t-shirt!  Grab our gear here...

http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.bigcartel.com

...and follow us at our other social hangouts!
http://www.bloglovin.com/blog/1815559
http://www.facebook.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles
http://www.twitter.com/CuteGirlHair
http://www.pinterest.com/MrsHairdo
http://www.instagram/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

To see how to do this on yourself, see the video...
http://www.youtube.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles#p/u/3/Y90s6neUKEY

This is a quick tutorial on how to create a "Waterfall French Braid" {also called a Cascade Braid or Fairytale Braid}. This hairdo requires a French Braid from the front, side of the head to the back, side of the head.  The key to the elegant look is instead of pulling more hair into the bottom strand as is typical of French Braiding... you allow it to fall and instead pick up a new strand from the bottom.  

You can do the same to the other side and connect them in the back, or use the Waterfall Braid in various combo styles! 

This is an elegant look and very good for moms, teens, and tweens! 

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHWaterfallBraid

Enjoy!

Please also do not forget to join our Facebook Page!
http://www.facebook.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles
